intro: Declieuxia saturejoides var. genuina, commonly known as the New Zealand mountain spinach, is a perennial herb native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, cool environments and is often found in alpine and subalpine regions. The leaves are edible and have been used traditionally by Māori for their nutritional and medicinal properties.
